predictions.text: The Federal Reserve will cut the target range for the federal funds rate by at least 25 basis points (one meeting action) versus its level on 2026-02-19.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if, in any FOMC post-meeting statement by the deadline, the announced target range upper bound is at least 0.25 percentage points lower than the upper bound in effect on 2026-02-19. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Fed minutes show officials split; some see room to ease as growth cools while inflation progress remains uncertain (Fed press release link in summary).
Falling mortgage rates and refinancing pickup are consistent with easing financial conditions.
monitoring_signals: CME FedWatch implied probabilities for cuts by Sep 2026
Core PCE inflation and CPI shelter components
Unemployment rate and initial claims trend
FOMC minutes and speeches emphasizing downside growth risks
predictions.rationale: Minutes indicate internal disagreement but non-trivial easing bias if growth softens further; still meaningful risk inflation stalls, limiting cuts.

predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing PMI will print below 48.0 in at least one monthly release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the Institute for Supply Management publishes a Manufacturing PMI (headline) < 48.0 for any month with release date on/before the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Investors are watching industrial production for recession vs soft-landing confirmation (G.17 context in summary).
Manufacturing surveys often weaken quickly when orders slow even if services remain resilient.
monitoring_signals: Fed G.17 industrial production and capacity utilization
Regional Fed manufacturing surveys (Empire, Philly, Dallas)
New orders and inventories subcomponents in ISM
Corporate earnings commentary from industrials
predictions.rationale: Downturn risk remains plausible with restrictive policy and fragile demand; however a soft landing could keep PMI near 50.

predictions.text: Freddie Mac will report the average 30-year fixed mortgage rate below 6.00% in at least one weekly Primary Mortgage Market Survey (PMMS).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any weekly Freddie Mac PMMS release on/before the deadline reports the 30-year fixed-rate mortgage average < 6.00%. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Mortgage rates recently fell to a month low and refinancing demand increased (CNBC link in summary).
If markets price more Fed easing or slower growth, long rates can drift lower.
monitoring_signals: 10-year Treasury yield level and volatility
MBS spreads and mortgage lender capacity
MBA refinance index
Inflation surprises and Fed communications
predictions.rationale: Rates have shown sensitivity to growth/inflation data; sub-6% is reachable if yields fall modestly, but inflation surprises could prevent it.

predictions.text: The IAEA Board of Governors will adopt a resolution formally censuring Iran (or finding Iran in non-compliance) regarding safeguards/nuclear cooperation.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the IAEA publicly reports (press release, official document, or widely cited official statement) that the Board of Governors adopted a resolution censuring Iran or declaring non-compliance by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Reporting highlights rising Iran-related strike preparations and elevated geopolitical risk (CNBC link in summary).
IAEA board actions often intensify during heightened nuclear tensions.
monitoring_signals: IAEA Director General statements and quarterly reports
Board of Governors meeting agendas and leaked drafts
EU3/U.S. diplomatic statements on safeguards access
Iran announcements on enrichment or inspector access
predictions.rationale: Escalating tensions make a formal IAEA step plausible, but diplomatic off-ramps or behind-the-scenes concessions could avert a censure vote.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Defense will award (new award or single modification) at least one contract for generative-AI/model services worth $200 million or more (ceiling or obligated value stated).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if a DoD contract announcement (DoD daily contract releases) or FPDS/SAM.gov record shows a single award/modification with stated value (obligated amount or total/ceiling) >= $200,000,000 for generative AI, foundation-model access, LLM services, or model training/inference platforms, by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Anthropic–Pentagon tensions underscore growing DoD demand and procurement pressure for deployable AI capabilities (CNBC link in summary).
DoD has a track record of large enterprise IT and cloud-style contract vehicles.
monitoring_signals: DoD CDAO and service-level AI solicitations (SAM.gov)
Large IDIQ vehicles referencing LLMs/foundation models
Public announcements by major model providers about defense contracts
Congressional NDAA language on AI procurement
predictions.rationale: Demand is strong but policy/safety constraints and procurement timelines may delay awards or keep contract sizes fragmented below the threshold.

predictions.text: FDA will approve Moderna’s mRNA seasonal influenza vaccine (mRNA-1010) for at least one adult indication in the U.S.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if FDA posts an approval (e.g., approval letter, press release, label update in Drugs@FDA) for Moderna mRNA-1010 (or clearly identified Moderna mRNA flu vaccine) for any adult age group by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: FDA reversed to review Moderna’s mRNA flu shot application after an initial refusal (CNBC link in summary).
Agency leadership is signaling interest in faster trial approvals amid competition concerns.
monitoring_signals: FDA advisory committee scheduling and briefing documents
PDUFA/decision timeline disclosures by Moderna
Additional clinical data releases and safety updates
Competitor flu vaccine approvals and guidance
predictions.rationale: Re-review increases odds, but approval still hinges on efficacy/safety package and FDA risk tolerance for a new platform in flu.

predictions.text: eBay will complete (close) its acquisition of Depop from Etsy.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if eBay or Etsy confirms via SEC filing, press release, or earnings materials that the Depop transaction has closed by the deadline. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Deal announced: Etsy agreed to sell Depop to eBay for $1.2B (CNBC link in summary).
Transaction size and vertical overlap suggest manageable antitrust risk.
monitoring_signals: Regulatory filings (UK CMA / EU / FTC if applicable)
Deal closing conditions and expected timeline in 10-Q/8-K
Any reported second requests or remedies
Earnings-call updates from eBay/Etsy
predictions.rationale: Most announced M&A of this scale closes, but cross-border regulatory review and resale/platform scrutiny could delay or add conditions.

predictions.text: A U.S. federal regulator will announce a public enforcement action with a monetary penalty of at least $5 million against a fintech company primarily for a consumer data breach impacting 500,000+ individuals.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if FTC/CFPB/SEC/OCC/FDIC/FRB (or another U.S. federal regulator) publishes an order/settlement/complaint by the deadline explicitly centered on a data breach at a fintech (non-bank financial platform), stating (a) impacted individuals >= 500,000 and (b) monetary penalty/redress >= $5,000,000. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Large fintech breach (~1M affected) highlights rising regulatory and reputational costs (TechCrunch link in summary).
Regulators have increased focus on cybersecurity governance and incident response in financial services.
monitoring_signals: FTC/CFPB enforcement dockets and press releases
SEC cyber disclosure enforcement actions
State AG multistate investigations that turn federal
Major breach notifications (8-Ks, state breach portals)
predictions.rationale: Enforcement is plausible given breach scale, but timelines can be long and penalties may be smaller or handled via private litigation.

predictions.text: Figma will raise its FY2026 revenue guidance by at least 10% versus the immediately prior FY2026 revenue guidance figure it provided.
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if, in an earnings release, shareholder letter, or earnings-call prepared remarks by the deadline, Figma increases its FY2026 revenue guidance midpoint (or single-point guidance) by >=10% compared to the prior stated FY2026 revenue guidance midpoint/single-point. Otherwise NO.
evidence: Figma’s shares reportedly surged on accelerating AI monetization (CNBC link in summary).
Software firms with measurable AI-driven monetization have recently been rewarded and often guide up.
monitoring_signals: Quarterly revenue growth and net retention disclosures
Attach rates for AI tiers and price increases
Customer count changes in enterprise segment
Competitive announcements from Adobe and other design suites
predictions.rationale: If AI monetization is real and sustained, guidance hikes are likely; but pricing pressure and competition can cap upside or lead to cautious guidance.
